*div1 type="summary"* *p*John A. Williams to James E. B. Austin, October 14, 1827. Notes for map of East Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Pine Bluff Trinity*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="10-14-1827">14th Octbr 1827*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Mr. James B. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Sir Inclosed you will receive a rough *location_mentioned*map */location_mentioned*of that part of the *location_mentioned*Province of Texas*/location_mentioned* lying *location_mentioned*between the Trinity and Sabine*/location_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Bound north by the St Antonio road,*/location_mentioned* and *location_mentioned*south by the gulf*/location_mentioned* The following remarks will serve in some measure to explain it.*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*From the San Antonio crossing of the Atoyac to its June- Course and distance. tion with Angeline_*/location_mentioned*___________________ S 00° —21 Mile*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*from Nacogdoches to the Junction of Toyac and Angeline*/location_mentioned*____S 44° E—35 m*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*from said junction to the Junction of the Angeline and Naches__*/location_mentioned*_____________________________S 16° E—26 m*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*from thence to Sabine lake*/location_mentioned*_______________________._ S 13° E—51m*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*from thence to the pass in the Gulf*/location_mentioned*___________________S 20° E—16 m*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*from thence through the pass__*/location_mentioned*__________________________S 18° E— 9 m*/p*
*p*The width of the *location_mentioned*creeks */location_mentioned*are laid down in yards *location_mentioned*opposite the mouth of each creek*/location_mentioned* where the width could be ascertained. Their length and general course could not be correctly ascertained. Their appearance on the *location_mentioned*map */location_mentioned*will perhaps be the best criterion. The width also, of some of the *location_mentioned*rivers */location_mentioned*are laid down in yards at different points*/p*
*p*For further information I must refer you to the *location_mentioned*Map*/location_mentioned*, which is laid down upon a scale of ten miles to an inch English measure. The marginal lines will aid you as to the *location_mentioned*cardinal points*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*I have not been able to learn anything that could be relied on relative to the *location_mentioned*waters of the San Jacinto.*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*The *location_mentioned*Sabine*/location_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Sabine lake*/location_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*pass into the gulf*/location_mentioned* and the *location_mentioned*coast */location_mentioned*on to *location_mentioned*point Bolivar*/location_mentioned* and also *location_mentioned*Trinity Bay*/location_mentioned* so far as it is laid down, together with *location_mentioned*creeks */location_mentioned*puting in has been laid down according to instructions recd from *person_mentioned*Cap1 Orr*/person_mentioned* who has navigated these waters*/p*
*p*The *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*Vills */location_mentioned*have been laid down partly from my own acquaintance with the geography of the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and partly by information from *person_mentioned*Capt Orr*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Mr Nash*/person_mentioned*, and a *person_mentioned*Coshata Indian*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*From the St Antonio crossing of the Atoyac down the Angeline Naches*/location_mentioned*, and the *location_mentioned*Sabine lake*/location_mentioned* has been laid down by my own observation as I decended these waters last *date_mentioned n="03-xx-1827">March*/date_mentioned*, but without compass or mathematical instruments *person_mentioned*Capt Orr*/person_mentioned*, however, and others who are acquainted with these waters have agreed with me in the general course and distances as laid down together with *location_mentioned*creeks */location_mentioned*The names of some of these *location_mentioned*creeks */location_mentioned*could not be ascertained consequently they were left blank I have no doubt but there are other *location_mentioned*creeks */location_mentioned*puting in which I did not discover, as the waters were very high at the time I came down. The *location_mentioned*Trinity */location_mentioned*is laid down from the best information the *person_mentioned*inhabitants */person_mentioned*can give. But no doubts many *location_mentioned*creeks */location_mentioned*are omitted.*/p*
*p*I am very sorry that the *location_mentioned*map */location_mentioned*which is inclosed is far from being perfect, The want of correct information from the *location_mentioned*non inhabited parts of the country*/location_mentioned*—the lack of mathematical instruments when I decended the *location_mentioned*Naches */location_mentioned*and the little reliance to be put upon the report of *person_mentioned*hunters */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*to whom I have been compelled to apply renders it impossible for a *location_mentioned*map */location_mentioned*to be perfect when founded upon such vague data. But we must content ourselves with probabilities when certainties are wanting.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Jn° A Williams */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
